headline: The Workings of Achieving a Oneness Ideologic Creed
description: A theological exploration that digs into the symbolic architecture beneath debates about Oneness and Trinitarianism, revealing how unity and multiplicity surface as archetypal tensions within the psyche.
author: Aleksandr Solnatus
whyItMatters: This piece reveals the totemic structure beneath doctrinal tension—how the mind holds God as both singular essence and relational plurality. It captures the moment where Aleksandr’s symbolic system interfaces with classical theology, exposing the deeper currents beneath belief itself.

articleExcerpt: “My first question is how can three people be one God without the argument collapsing into the all mighty power of God to do anything?”
sourceFragments: Good opening question. It gets to the structural tension that makes the doctrine so persistent and so divisive.
Let’s look at it from each angle before taking sides.
